results.title: Circulating renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system activity in cats with systemic hypertension or cardiomyopathy
results.text_hl: To document RAAS activity in @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@SH@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@CM@@@ compared to healthy @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ and determine how RAAS profiles change with @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Ward JL, Guillot E, Domenig O, Ware WA, Yuan L, Mochel JP. Circulating renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system activity in cats with systemic hypertension or cardiomyopathy J Vet Intern Med. 2022 May;36(3):897-909. PMID: 35285549

results.title: The impact of medical interventions on admission characteristics in children with congenital heart disease and cardiomyopathy.
results.text_hl: The medical interventions with benefit for all endpoints after multivariate regression analyses in this cohort are @CHEMICAL_Methylprednisolone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008775 @@@methylprednisolone@@@, @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@. CONCLUSIONS: Diuretics, @CHEMICAL_Steroids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013256 @@@steroids@@@, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, calcium channel blockers, and beta blockers all appear to offer beneficial effects in paediatric @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@cardiomyopathy@@@ admission outcomes.

citations.NLM: Loomba RS, Rausa J, Dorsey V, Bronicki RA, Villarreal EG, Flores S. The impact of medical interventions on admission characteristics in children with congenital heart disease and cardiomyopathy. Cardiol Young. 2021 Mar;31(3):406-413. PMID: 33222712

results.title: Efficacy and safety of calcium channel blockers in preventing cardiac siderosis in thalassemia patients: An updated meta-analysis with trial sequential analysis.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Our meta-analysis found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ significantly increases cardiac T2* and decreases MIC, hence decreasing the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@cardiomyopathy@@@-related @DISEASE_Iron_Overload @DISEASE_MESH:D019190 @@@iron overload@@@ in @DISEASE_Thalassemia @DISEASE_MESH:D013789 @@@thalassemia@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Soliman Y, Abdelaziz A, Mouffokes A, Amer BE, Goudy YM, Abdelwahab OA, Badawy MM, Diab RA, Elsharkawy A. Efficacy and safety of calcium channel blockers in preventing cardiac siderosis in thalassemia patients: An updated meta-analysis with trial sequential analysis. Eur J Haematol. 2022 Dec 24;():. PMID: 36565288
